cinnamon.engine.system

Class ConcurrentConsoleInput<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.ConcurrentConsoleInput<E>

  • public abstract class ConcurrentConsoleInput<E>
extends Object

    Access to console input without blocking the main thread.

    Implementors must override four methods: onNextLine(String) to modify or throw away undesirable input prior to creating a message, isStopRequest(String) to choose the desired stop String, and createMessage(String) to construct a E to be polled by another thread.

    All public methods are thread-safe.

    Created by chris on 2/7/2017.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConcurrentConsoleInput

        public ConcurrentConsoleInput(String intro,
                              String outro)

        Constructor for ConcurrentConsoleInput.

        Parameters:
        intro - message to print after start() is called.
        outro - message to print after stop() is called.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the intro or outro text is null, empty, or made of whitespace.

    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()

        Checks whether or not console input is being read.

        Returns:
        true if console input is actively read.

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty()

        Checks whether or not any E messages are available from the console.

        Returns:
        true if messages are available.f

      • poll

        public final E poll()

        Removes the oldest available E console input.

        Returns:
        message.

      • start

        public final void start()

        Starts receiving console input on a Thread other than the one calling this method.

        This method should be treated as Thread.start() and must not be called more than once, even if stop() has already been called.

        Throws:
        IllegalThreadStateException - if this method is called more than once.

      • stop

        public final void stop()

        Requests a stop to listening for console input.
